data.title: Undergraduate, Graduate and Transfer
data.meta_description: Webster Geneva Campus welcomes students from around the globe, either for a bachelor or master's degree, or just for a semester or summer abroad. Join us!
data.text:
It is recognized among top higher education institutions globally â€” see our Rankings and Recognitions. According to UniRanks, Webster Geneva is ranked as the No. 1 private university in Switzerland. Our dedication to academic innovation, world-class programs, and elite faculty offer our students an unparalleled educational journey.

Upon your arrival in Switzerland, it's essential to apply for your Student Permit within 14 days. After registering at the cantonal migration office, please keep in mind that the permit processing might take a few weeks. During this period, you may receive a temporary document to maintain your legal status in Switzerland.

Extended Freshman Application Deadline for August 2024 Term: June 30, 2024*

*If places are still available, Freshman applications may be accepted after June 30. Check Admission Status

For most Webster scholarships: May 3

At Webster Geneva Campus, you can apply online for any of our five annual intakes. Non-EU/EEA students should apply at least three months before a term begins due to visa requirements. For EU/EEA students, it's one month prior. For exact deadlines or admissions questions, contact our Admissions team. We're ready to help with your application journey.

Extended Freshman Application Deadline for August 2024 Term: June 30, 2024*

*If places are still available, Freshman applications may be accepted after June 30. Check Admission Status

At Webster Geneva Campus, our admissions decisions are made on a rolling basis. Typically, you can expect a response within 1 week once we have ALL necessary documents. For a smooth evaluation, ensure your application is comprehensive. The essentials include:

A copy of your passport.

A CV outlining your academic and professional journey.

Two recommendation letters for both undergraduate and graduate applications, or one for university transfers.

A 500-word essay detailing your background, academic aspirations, professional goals, and reasons for choosing our program.

Relevant transcripts: High school for bachelor's applicants, and bachelor's for master's applicants. Note: Master's applicants should have an undergraduate degree from an institution recognized by Webster Geneva.

Results from an English Proficiency Examination.

Experience the vibrant student life and campus housing at Webster Geneva Campus! Immerse yourself in the dynamic world of our students through our social media accounts:

Instagram: @webstergenevacampus

Facebook: @webstergenevacampus

TikTok: @webstergeneva

Linkedin: @webstergenevacampus

For an inside look at the exciting campus adventures, follow our student stories and discover the enriching student life and campus experiences that make Webster Geneva Campus the perfect choice for your academic journey.

To complete your visa application successfully, ensure you have the following documents ready:

Visa Application Form: Complete and sign the original of the visa application form type D. Note that incomplete or unsigned applications will not be accepted.

Passport Photos: Provide four recent passport photos. Digital files and photocopies are not acceptable.

Passport Copy: Include a photocopy of your passport.

Letter of Admission: Submit the original and a copy of your admission letter from Webster Geneva Campus.

Attestation in French: Include the original and a copy of the attestation in French provided by Webster Geneva Campus.

Previous Diplomas and Certificates: Provide copies of your previous diplomas and school certificates.

Resume/CV: Include a copy of your resume/CV detailing your biographical data and schools attended.

Proof of Funds: Submit bank statements showing sufficient funds (approximately CHF 25,000) to cover tuition, housing and other expenses for one year.

Confirmation of Deposit: Provide confirmation of your deposit to Webster Geneva Campus (Foundation Webster).

Confirmation of Departure: Include a written confirmation/declaration signed by you, stating your intention to leave Switzerland after completing your education at Webster Geneva Campus.

Letter of Intention: Provide a letter of intention or statement of purpose, outlining your future plans. This letter must be signed by you.

Visa Fee and Postage Fee: Pay the applicable visa fee and postage fee. Visit the website for current fees.

Student Schedule: Contact Peter Carson at petercarson43@webster.edu for your student schedule.

Please ensure that your application file is complete, as incomplete submissions will not be processed by the OCPM, potentially delaying the issuance of your visa.
